content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = String[]
    in_code_block = false
    current_block = ""

    for line in split(md, "\n")
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            in_code_block = true
            current_block = ""
        elseif startswith(line, "```") && in_code_block
            push!(code_blocks, current_block)
            in_code_block = false
        elseif in_code_block
            current_block *= line * "\n"
        end
    end
    
    if in_code_block
        push!(code_blocks, current_block)
    end
    
    join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

This function goes through every line in the markdown document. When it encounters a "```julia" line, it starts building a code block. When it encounters a "```" line after a "```julia" line, it ends the code block and adds it to a list of code blocks. If there's still a code block when the end of the document is reached, it adds that block to the list as well. Finally, it joins all the code blocks with newlines in between.
